page.title: 16FARMING IN FERNESS
page.content: A typical hill farm in the area consists of 860 acres, 700 of which is rough grazing and another 70 acres for silage and hay. 15 acres of barley,5 of turnips and half an acre for potatoes are also grown. The tasks are many and various (especially in Spring and harvest) and involves two men full time and another part-time together with much specialised machinery _ even a snowplough! The stock includes 93 cows,each with a calf, 2 bulls and 4 bulling heifers (1-2 years old) A typical year includes calving -from October to April, feeding (through winter) ploughing and sowing (in Spring), cutting silage (June) and hay (July), harvesting(August). Potatoes are lifted in October and turnips in December. Calves are sold in Spring and Autumn.
